tools.pki.gbay.crypto.provider

Class SoftCert

  • java.lang.Object
    • tools.pki.gbay.crypto.provider.SoftCert
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CryptoServiceProvider

    public class SoftCert
extends Object
implements CryptoServiceProvider
    The Class SoftCert is used for all private keys, public keys and related certificate

      VerifiedText verify(SignedText text, PlainText originalText)
      * Verifies a signed text, if the signedText has it's own crl will verifies over it, if not it verifies over the CRL of SoftCert Object As for Issuers it will verifys to all issuers inside of signedText and SoftCert, if the text is signed with even only one trusted issuer it can be verified.

      • sign

        public SignedTextInterface sign(PlainText text,
                                KeySelectionInterface selectingFunction)
                         throws CryptoException
        Use KeyStorage to sign a text. To sign using this function you need to set the KeyStorage First
        Parameters:
        text - the text
        selectingFunction - the selecting function
        Returns:
        the signed text interface
        Throws:
        CryptoException - the gbay crypto exception

      • isSelfSigned

        public static boolean isSelfSigned(X509Certificate cert)
                            throws CertificateException,
                                   NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                   NoSuchProviderException
        Checks whether given X.509 certificate is self-signed.
        Parameters:
        cert - the cert
        Returns:
        true, if checks if is self signed
        Throws:
        CertificateException - the certificate exception
        NoSuchAlgorithmException - the no such algorithm exception
        NoSuchProviderException - the no such provider exception

      • verify

        public VerifiedText verify(SignedText text,
                           PlainText originalText)
                    throws CryptoException
        * Verifies a signed text, if the signedText has it's own crl will verifies over it, if not it verifies over the CRL of SoftCert Object As for Issuers it will verifys to all issuers inside of signedText and SoftCert, if the text is signed with even only one trusted issuer it can be verified.
        Specified by:
        verify in interface CryptoServiceProvider
        Parameters:
        text - the text
        originalText - the original text
        Returns:
        the verified text
        Throws:
        CryptoException - the gbay crypto exception

      • isRevoked

        public boolean isRevoked()
                  throws CryptoException
        Check if cert is revoked, if you set certrepos URL to null and retry counts to -1 it will use default values in configuration.
        Returns:
        true, if checks if is revoked
        Throws:
        CryptoException - the gbay crypto exception
